page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF AREA
page.content: This area lies northwest of Somerton and is a secluded region. To the north the land is flat, part of the Somerton Moor. The land is well drained with deeply dug ditches. To the south on the periphery are low undulating hills. The land is mainly pasture (dairy) but the fields which have been harrowed are fertile and wheat and potatoes are grown. Many of the fields are small, however, and remain rough pasture. The settlemant is dispersed with no community centre within the block and consists of individual farms. There are a few modern residences however. The roads running through the area are narrow lanes with high uncut hedges. There are also many tracks and dead end roads off these lanes.
